data.title: Love this place
data.text:
Great place to eat!
Staff is always friendly and  helpful. Food is always good. Never had a problem while eating here. One of the best Mexican restaurants in the area.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: The best Mexican restaurant in NWA. Lived here for 3 years now and tried the all. I would encourage you to try different things on the menu and do not be afraid to ask for it the way you want. They will modify any meal or make items not on the menu for you if you just ask. Managers name is Cesar and our favorite waiter is Israel. Awesome atmosphere and great people.

data.title: Very good...tasted like Tex-Mex to these 3 transplanted Texans!
data.text: Had lunch with girlfriends on a day out to shop and celebrate a birthday. Everything on our plate was excellent!  Started out with good chips and 3 different salsas followed by a lunch special of a cheese and onion enchilada, beef taquito, retried beans and rice. Great brewed ice tea and service was impeccable! We loved the atmosphere and old brick interior. Very inexpensive was just icing or 'lettuce on the taco'! 🌮 😀  Will be our to-go place for Mexican food!

data.title: Best Mexican food
data.text:
I love Mexican food and anytime I get the chance, I will always pick it. I took my German fiance to a couple different places in rogers to try and this one was the best. 
To start:
Food was a 10 out of 10. Was exactly what I wanted and the staff made it very clear that they would cater to my vegetarian better half. 
Service was a 10 out of 10. Always refilling drinks and being very quick and prompt. They key for me was when 2 gentlemen walked in at about 4 min before closing time and they were greeted with a smile. When they asked about closing time, the female server told them that it was okay and not to worry about closing time. Just excellent service. 
Cleanliness was a 7 out of 10. Strictly because of the poor condition of the bathroom, everything else was fine.

data.title: Never had a bad meal here
data.text: Las Palmas is consistent and always tasty!  I frequent Las Palmas for lunch, but this particular occasion I was on a business lunch.  As soon as you are seated you are brought salsa, my favorite is the spicy!  Service is speedy and my order is always correct.  Highly recommend Las Palmas for lunch or dinner any day of the week!  Perk:  parking in downtown Rogers is free everywhere!

data.title: We visit each time we are back in town
data.text: If you want great tasting and reasonably priced Mexican food served by friendly staff, Las Palmas is the place.

data.title: Good Mexican resturant
data.text: Mexican food served with a south of the border look. There are a number of items on the menu with pictures of most items. Ordering is made easy with number for each item.

data.title: Loud!
data.text:
The food is good and it's not too pricey, but it is loud.
I was there on a Sunday evening when they had a live singer . He was alright I guess, but the effect was just loud. Difficult to make the servers hear you , impossible to have intimate conversation .
Still, it's a worth a visit .

data.title: nice place, not too pricey
data.text: I love this place.  Good relaxing atmosphere and good, not fancy or pricey, but good food.  in the best part of town, not resturant row.

data.title: Good, but nothing special
data.text: We popped in for an early Saturday evening dinner at Las Palmas.  They do have a bar however we chose to skips drinks.  The chips and salsa served were pretty good.  Our food was served quickly and was tasty, but not so much that we will make a special trip back to this restaurant.  The best thing about our time at Las Palmas was the live entertainment.  I wish I could remember her name, but she was a 17 yr old young lady from Springdale, AR that sang and played guitar.  She was really good at contemporary and some old classics!

data.title: Sunday afternoon lunch
data.text: We went on a sunday afternoon. We ordered a chicken dish that sounded very good on the menu. The chicken was dry and obviously had been pre cooked. Sorry to say we were disappointed.

data.title: Great little Mexican place
data.text: This is one of our favorite places for Mexican food. Usually packed on weekends so be prepared for a short wait but worth it. The beers are cold, the quest good and about one of the best quesadillas we've had anywhere.

data.title: Good Mexican restaurant great value
data.text: I have been there a couple times in the last few weeks and the food was good.  The service was friendly and fast.  Pretty solid place and my friend said the drinks were pretty good as well

data.title: You feel like you're in Mexico
data.text: So much to choose from the extensive menu.  The food was good and arrived quickly.  The decor and ambiance has an authentic feel.

data.title: One of our favorites
data.text: It's close to our home and a local restaurant not a chain. The food is great and the staff is always friendly and hardworking.

data.title: So-so, but....
data.text:
It took a while for us to get service, and then it took a while to get our food. Our chips came before our drinks, and the mild salsa tasted like canned tomato sauce. I ordered the tamales and cheese enchilada, and I didn't care for the tamales. The masa was reddish and I didnt like whatever the flavor was. Also, the meat was ground beef, and I prefer shredded. 
On the bright side, my husband had Chile Colorado and he loved the pork. (Someone mentioned homemade tortillas in an earlier review-my husband's tortillas were not homemade.) Also, many people in the restaurant were ordering fajitas and they looked like a specialty there, so they were probably good.

data.title: Love it
data.text: Oh I love to eat here.  They have fresh hot or mild salsa and chips.  They have great Margaritas if you like them.  The Long Island ice teas are good too.  I like getting combination plates because I can have different entrees.  They are usually very busy.  There are areas for big parties so if you need to seat a lot of people together they can handle it.

data.title: Good food, but a bit noisy
data.text: Happened upon here after looking for a dinner place in downtown rogers.  We were pleasantly surprised by the food.  I had the Chicken Laredo and my wife had the Chicken Flautas.  Both were very good and tasty.  they were served with rice, refried beans, Pico de Gallo, sour cream, and guacamole.  My dinner also came with my choice of corn or flour tortillas.  I chose flour and they came hot, wrapped in foil - very good.  Service was OK, not terrific, but not bad.  The restaurant is naturally noisy (all concrete inside), which provided quite an amplifier to the two little ones (at two different tables) who frequently used high pitched shrieks to get attention.  Our ears hurt.  Next time I will scout out the best room to avoid the noise.  Maybe the back room is quieter....

data.title: We stumbled on to a treasure
data.text: Driving through Rogers, we decided to look for a place to eat in the historic downtown area.  Las Palmas was a delightful choice.  I had the chicken fajitas.  They were excellent.  The flour tortillas seemed very fresh.  Staff was friendly.  It was less expensive than I had expected.  Our lunch total for the two of us was under $17.

data.title: Que Delicious...authentic Mexican
data.text: This is one of our favorites. Everything is fresh and very tasty. Amazing guacamole, carne asana tacos with fresh lime, and real margaritas. To end your meal try the creamy made from scratch flan. You can bring a large group of people, there's plenty of room. The staff is friendly and on top of things.
